title.rendered: IPhone vs Samsung Top 5 sports apps for smartphones

content.rendered:
In the new day and age of smartphones, owning one now means you never have to wait to find out who is winning the game, keeping up-to-date on your fantasy team or checking out who has racked up the most points and assists all while your on the go.

Sports apps give you the latest news, statistics, schedules and match information, within these apps you may even be able to live-stream your favorite game. Here are the top 5 sports apps for all the fans.Sky Sports

Keeping up with the biggest and latest sports news comes with great ease with the Sky Sports app, Live TV section featuring main events, football, F1, Cricket, Golf and sports news. Optimised design for both iPhone and IPad, for any Sky Sports customer this is a must need app for all smartphone owners, works both on Android and iPhone.Premier League – Official app

Providing fans with the perfect app to keep up with the excitement and drama of the worlds most watched league. Enabling you to watch some of the greatest moments in the league’s history, fixtures, results and tables.  Able to establish your own fantasy league team and compete with people around the world or even create a private league among your friends. The app is free for everyone, available on iPhones as well as Android phones.Bet365

The name Bet365 would make anyone assume that this is a betting app, not only is it a betting app for sports, they provide the latest scores. Offering an extensive range of sporting action streamed live to your iPhone, IPad, Samsung, and Nokia phones.LiveScore

LiveScore provides up to the minute scores and standings on a variety of sports. Its reliable, no-nonsense app that gives you exactly what its name insists.  Delivers the latest from football, basketball, hockey, tennis and cricket. With its simple design and low clutter around the screen, its easy to see why LiveScore is a popular app among many.

Free on Android and IOSBT Sports

Those of us with BT Sports subscription, can now download the new app and be able to keep up to date with schedules, fixtures, league tables and watch live TV including ESPN and Box Nation on the go. Free to download on both iOS and Android devices.

Which ever smartphone you have whether it’s an iPhone, Samsung, Nokia or a LG phone, there are plenty of sport apps to keep you up to date. Can you imagine watching match of the day on your new iPhone X? Edge to edge display, clear and crisp screen.
